issues.description: The problem statement and template require a public Farm.singFarmSong() method (UML and task text explicitly mention singFarmSong()), but the solution implementation does not provide singFarmSong(); instead it provides a method named playFarmSong(). This is a signature/name mismatch between the expected API and the solution reference. Students looking at the solution repository will not find the required singFarmSong() method and may be confused about which method to implement or call; tests or example code (Main.java) that call singFarmSong() will not match the solution implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution match the specified API: rename playFarmSong() to singFarmSong(), or add a public singFarmSong() method that delegates to the existing implementation (e.g., singFarmSong() { playFarmSong(); }). Also ensure Main and any test/example code consistently call singFarmSong(). This preserves the educational intent while removing the naming mismatch.

issues.description: The problem statement and template define and expect a public method named singFarmSong() on Farm (UML and textual spec). The solution implementation, however, provides a public method named playFarmSong() instead of singFarmSong(), while keeping a private singFarmSongVerse(Animal). This renaming breaks the straightforward mapping from the exercise description/template to the solution API: students looking for or asked to implement singFarmSong() will not find the corresponding public method in the solution, and uncommenting the example Main (which calls singFarmSong()) would not compile against the solution Farm class. This inconsistency creates unnecessary cognitive load and a potential compilation/mapping error.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the public API name in the solution with the problem and template. Rename the solution's playFarmSong() method to singFarmSong(), or add a public singFarmSong() that delegates to the existing implementation (e.g., public void singFarmSong() { for (Animal a : animals) singFarmSongVerse(a); }). This preserves the private singFarmSongVerse(Animal) helper and makes the solution consistent with the exercise specification and template.
